verb.description: Continuously toss into the air and catch (a number of objects) so as to keep at least one in the air while handling the others, typically for the entertainment of others.

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense entertain with jesting, tricks, etc.): back-formation from juggler, or from Old French jogler, from Latin joculari to jest, from joculus, diminutive of jocus jest. Current senses date from the late 19th century.
